Authors:
Marina Triantafyllou, Ioanna Pyrri, Aristeidis Parmakelis,
Zacharoula Gonou-Zagou
Title:
Two rare and interesting species of the genus Tricholomopsis
in Greece
Keywords:
T. flammula; T. sulphureoides; Morphology; ITS region;
Îœolecular phylogeny; Europe
Abstract:
The genus Tricholomopsisis represented in Europe by a
small number of species. In recent studies the presence of six species
in Europe was confirmed, namely Tricholomopsis rutilans, T. decora, T.
flammula, T. sulphureoides, T. pteridicola and T. badinensis. T.
rutilans and T. decora are characterized as common species in Europe,
whereas T. flammula and T. sulphureoides are considered rare with
limited references.This study reports the presence of T. flammula and T.
sulphureoides in Greece, providing new data on the morphology,
phylogeny, distribution and rarity of these species.
